#summary Get Unique Pass ID (by share ID) (**MOVED TO GITHUB**)

= Note: This project has moved to [https://github.com/PassKit/PassKitSDK PassKit/PassKitSDK on GitHub]. =

= Get Unique Pass ID (by share ID) =

|| *URI* || `https://api.passkit.com/v1/pass/shareid/`<font color="blue">{shareId}</font><font color="grey"> _/full_ (optional)</font><font color="grey"> _/?format=xml_ (optional)</font> ||
|| *Verb* || GET ||
|| *Auth* || Yes ||

This method performs a look-up based upon the share ID of the pass. The share ID is another unique identifier for the pass that is used to determine parent/child relationships between passes.

The method returns the unique pass ID for the pass if it finds the record with <font color="blue">{shareId}</font>.

== URL Parameters ==

  * <font color="blue">*shareId*</font> <font color="green">_(string)_</font> The share ID of the pass.

=== cURL Syntax ===

<code>curl --digest -u {APIKey}:{APISecret} "https://api.passkit.com/v1/pass/shareid/{shareId}"</code>

----
  
== Response Examples ==

==== JSON Format ====

<code language="json">
{
  "success": true,
  "uniqueID": "uniqueId"
}</code>

==== XML Format ====

_Note that for XML responses, spaces in tag names will be replaced by 'middle dot' (Â·).  If a tag starts with an invalid character (E.g. a Number), the tag will be prefixed with two underscores (`__`_)_
{{{

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<PassKit_API_Response>
    <success>1</success>
    <uniqueID>uniqueId</uniqueID>
</PassKit_API_Response>
}}}

=== Response Parameters === 
  * *<font color="blue">success</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ Will return <font color="purple">true</font> for a successful submission, or will not be present in the case of an error.
  * *<font color="blue">uniqueId</font>* <font color="green">_(array)_</font>
    *_ The unique pass ID of the pass.
